images.copyright: Flowing river inside a glacier cave, Vatnajökull, Iceland (© Marco Bottigelli/Getty Images)
images.title: Ice, ice, caving
images.caption: Glacier cave in Iceland
images.desc: The Land of Fire and Ice is home to countless natural wonders, like this brilliant blue cave formed within the ice of a glacier. (Glacier caves are often called ice caves, but the term 'ice cave' is properly used to describe a bedrock cave that contains year-round ice; a glacier cave is formed entirely within the ice of a glacier.) The majority of Iceland's glacier caves are in Vatnajökull glacier, which covers about 8% of the island nation and is one of the largest glaciers in Europe.
